oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Children feted at party at Day Home, circa 1950 December 18
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of some of the Fannie Battle children at the 1950 Christmas dinner at the Fannie Battle Day Home. The children attending the party numbered fifty, some of them seen in the photograph opening their favors, which were red Santa Claus bags filled with hard candies. The caption to this photograph cites that the Day Home was "maintained with funds raised each Christmas Eve by the bands of carolers who tour the city and outlying districts singing at each home where a candle burns in the window." This photograph illustrated the newspaper article "Children feted at party at Day Home," published in the 18 December 1950 issue of the Nashville Banner. Forms part of the Fannie Battle Day Home Records. 1 photograph : b & w ; 8 x 10 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fannie Battle Day Home; Fannie Battle Social Workers
